text:
Hi everyone! I have just joined so please let me know if there is a better place for me to post this or has already been covered elsewhere.

I am currently migrating some of our old HubSpot integrations (using public apps & the now sunset API keys) over to using auth tokens. As we had things previously set up the following would take place:
1. Direct user to install url
2. Redirect to redirect uri and check if we already have an installation on said portal by checking if we have a record in our db. 
3. If we do, return an already installed message, if not save a new record for the portal. 
This was seemingly working previously without generating an initial access token and refresh token, but I have now however added this in.

As explained above we previously checking wether an account already had the app installed by checking if we had a record for a given portal id in our db. We however obtained the portal id to check against by calling the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/get-account-details|/integrations/v1/me> endpoint with the api key. This however can no longer be done prior to an account having been fully installed by <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/oauth2/get-access-and-refresh-tokens|generating the initial tokens> as an access code is needed.

I was wondering if there is a workaround or wether we need to generate the tokens every time someone tries to install the app (even if it has previously been installed) and amend our record of the refresh token if the portal has already been saved?

Hi, is Line Item properties a thing? Or would it be a Product property actually, Product becoming a Line Item when added to a Deal?

I want to add a tax code to a line item (but the tax code does not follow the product, it follows the Customer's shipping address, which is unique per Deal of course)
Yeah you need to create a product property and then those will follow through to each line item

ok that was how I read that too, that Products become Line items.

So the logic is I can then edit that Line Item's TaxCode property without messing up the original product's TaxCode?
Yep
(just tried it :grin: ) and yeah
Nice!
So basically a Line item is a Product _copied_ to a Deal (not hard referencing the original product anymore)
I see the same applies to price and such. Pretty logical when you think about it, that you'd add a Product and then edit its price, description or whatever, without messing up the original Product…

Hello everyone! Is there a way to get historical line item data? I am pulling data via the API but every time a line item is edited on the HubSpot interface it creates a new line item object with a new ID and deletes the old version of the same line item. The response has a "versions" section but it is always the last value of the property.
Is it feasible to enroll a new deal in a workflow with any endpoint?

Ran into another issue with new App Auth process...
When we initialize we check for usage counts and it looks like were getting a failure on the scope...but have literally selected every scope option!



HERE IS THE CODE:
-----------------
string url = string.Format("<https://api.hubapi.com/integrations/v1/limit/daily/>");
ClientRequest clientRequest = new ClientRequest(url);
clientRequest.Request.Method = Method.GET;
clientRequest.Request.AddHeader("Accept", "application/json");
clientRequest.Request.AddHeader("Authorization", $"Bearer {HubSpotv2.BearerKey}");
clientRequest.Request.AddHeader("Content-Type", "application/json");



HERE IS THE ERROR:
------------------
{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "The scope needed for this API call isn't available for public use. If you have questions, contact support or post in our developer forum.",
  "correlationId": "228b2eed-26ae-4fcd-887a-729ae8d6b307",
  "links": {
    "support": "<https://help.HubSpot.com/>",
    "forum": "<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations>"
  },
  "category": "MISSING_SCOPES"
}

try gear icon (settings) on the top right, then API Key on the left and then the call log tab you can filter calls by date.
The best workaround that we have is that you could set up your deal workflow with enrollment criteria based on a property, and update the deal's property via the CRM API
I've seen people successfully use that approach
Yep. just like angus said, just create a property called trigger workflow and then set the enrollment trigger to be when the property is true, then just update the property via the api
Solved! The problem was that my “Bearer” was “BEARER”
Thanks

Hello guys, we are about to implement the HubSpot API on our website sign up process, the idea is to add people as contacts on HubSpot when they create an account on our website. But i had a question about a specific field but i cannot find any information on the developer docs about this. How can we set the Marketing contact or Non-marketing contact via API?

Found this article but it is from 2021, not sure if it is still the case
```It is not possible to modify the Marketing contact status property using HubSpot's API endpoints; however, you can look up the status of a record using the Read Contacts endpoint and hs_marketable_status as the internal value for the Marketing contact status property.```
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/integrations/manage-marketing-contacts-settings-for-your-integrations>

The attachment contains the field we want to set from the API

PD: I don’t have experience in HubSpot i expected to find something in the docs but no luck so far => <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

I expected to be able to send something like this
```properties = {
    "company": "Biglytics",
    "email": "<mailto:bcooper@biglytics.net|bcooper@biglytics.net>",
    "firstname": "Bryan",
    "lastname": "Cooper",
    "phone": "<tel:(877)929-0687|(877) 929-0687>",
    "website": "<http://biglytics.net|biglytics.net>",
    "marketingcontactstatus": "marketing contact" or "non-marketing contact"
}```
Hi everyone, Is it possible to use HUBDB as my database in WordPress?
Unfortunately not. HUBDB is not a replacement for a full MySQL database
